https://prez.dev/description.@value: The status of this register entry
The subject is an instance of a class.
The property that identifies the version IRI of an ontology.
A set of concepts, optionally including statements about semantic relationships between those concepts
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept
Relates, by convention, a concept scheme to a concept which is topmost in the broader/narrower concept hierarchies for that scheme, providing an entry point to these hierarchies
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language
If this Entity prov:wasAttributedTo Agent :ag, then it can qualify how it was influenced using prov:qualifiedAttribution [ a prov:Attribution;  prov:agent :ag; :foo :bar ].

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The primary purpose for which a borehole was drilled or any secondary purpose that the borehole may acquire during its lifecycle. The vocabulary focuses on drilling purposes within the resources industry, with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. Some terms covered by jurisdictional legislation are highlighted in the provenance field. Variations in terminology within definitions (i.e. usage of borehole, well and wellbore) stem from usage in different sectors of the resources industry, but for the purpose of this vocabulary are considered to be equivalent. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Definitions in this vocabulary were compiled from authoritative sources and/or adapted from related vocabularies:
1) The Drilling Manual, Sixth Edition, 2020,  Australian Drilling Industry Association (ADIA)
2) Australian Drilling Manual 1995, Australian Drilling Industry Training Committee Limited
3) European Commission (Europa) INSPIRE registry - Borehole Purpose (http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/BoreholePurposeValue)
4) Geological Survey of Queensland (GSQ) - Borehole Purpose (http://linked.data.gov.au/def/borehole-purpose) and Borehole Sub-Purpose (http://linked.data.gov.au/def/borehole-sub-purpose)
5) Geoscience Australia (GA) - Borehole Geology - Purpose (https://pid.geoscience.gov.au/def/voc/ga/BoreholePurpose)
6) PPDM Association - (https://ppdm.org/ppdm/PPDM/resources/Technical_Publications/PPDM/Technical_Publications.aspx)
7) Mining Proposal Guidance v 4.0, January 2023, Department of Energy, Mines, Industry Regulation and Safety (DEMIRS)
8) Western Australian water in mining guideline, 2013, Department of Water.
9) Minimum Construction Requirements for Water Bores in Australia, 2020, National Uniform Drillers Licensing Committee
10) Managed aquifer recharge in Western Australia, 2021, Department of Water and Environmental Regulation
11) Interactive water science monitoring and data, Department of Water and Environmental Regulation
12) Class VI - Wells used for Geologic Sequestration of Carbon Dioxide, United States Environmental Protection Authority
13) Oil & Gas Drilling Glossary - IADC Lexicon

This vocabulary was discussed at a national level via the Government Geoscience Information Committee (GGIC) Petroleum Data Working Group, leading to a more consistent approach by different jurisdictions.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: The primary purpose for which a borehole was drilled or any secondary purpose that the borehole may acquire during its lifecycle. The vocabulary focuses on drilling purposes within the resources industry, with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. Some terms covered by jurisdictional legislation are highlighted in the provenance field. Variations in terminology within definitions (i.e. usage of borehole, well and wellbore) stem from usage in different sectors of the resources industry, but for the purpose of this vocabulary are considered to be equivalent. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium).
An entry that is seen as having a reasonable measure of stability, may be used to mark the full adoption of a previously 'experimental' entry.
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork
The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed
The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed
Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property
The publisher of the creative work
The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource
